name: plantbreeding
tagline: plantbreeding: R Software package for analysis and visualization of data from plant breeding and genetics experiments.
body:
#  Welcome to plantbreeding package project

The R-package plantbreeding collection of functions for analysis of data and visualization of results from Plant Breeding and Genetics experiments. Different functionalities of this project include different aspects of data analysis plant breeding specialized experiments and designs such as Planning and Analysis of Plant breeding specialized designs, Estimation of variance components, heritability, and genetic correlation, Stability and genotype x environment interaction analysis
Diversity and variability analysis, Selection and Selection index and some plotting features. 

One of the main reasons for developing this package is that develop functions that are interest to plant breeders and geneticists. Your feedback and suggestions are welcome. 

**Licensing and WARRANTY**

The package comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details see http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html (GPL)

If you have used the package in your publication, please cite the package. 


**Installation and Download**

To install the latest development version of package `plant breeding` from R-Forge (if you are running a recent R version), use

`install.packages("plantbreeding",repos="http://r-forge.r-project.org")`

The program is also available here at **Github**. 

Current version of `plantbreeding` is 1.1.1

Note: The current version of plantbreeding has fewer functions than 1.1.0 but do not depend upon any other packages. 
PDF manual pdf version of plantbreeding manual can be available on request. 


**Developer / Maintainer:**

The package is developed and maintained by Umesh Rosyara, University of Wisconsin, Madison.The bugs and suggestions can be mailed to the developer rosyara_at_wisc_dot_edu.
